result.execSummary:
The defendant Edwynn Orlando White was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments, Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes:
Restitution Hearing scheduled for 07/23/2015 @ 8:30am
Probation Review Hearing scheduled for 10/23/2015 @ 1:3pm, Br-40

miscConds.notes: Pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the DOC's. Court found the Domestic Abuse surcharge is applicable. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
- No firearms/weapons. Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the No Contact Order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

- Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling and/or Anger Management counseling.
- Participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
- Maintain absolute sobriety.
- Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
- NO VIOLENT CONTACT with the victim rising to the level of probable cause for arrest.
- Pay all supervision fees as determined by the DOC's.
- Obtain/maintain employment.

timeConds.notes: Huber for work and child care. Defendant to report on 06-22-15.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Edwynn Orlando White

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Edwynn Orlando White in court.  Patrick D. Winter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.

Attorney Elizabeth A Carlson in court.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
For reasons stated on the record, Court orders restitution set at $0.

Defendant Edwynn Orlando White in court with attorney Elizabeth A Carlson.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
JUDGE BOROWSKI FOR JUDGE DALLET.
Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.   Defendant sentenced to serve 9 months in the House of Correction with credit for 4 days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 18 months.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 30 days with huber for work and child care in the House of Correction.  Defendant to report on 6/22/15.
-Court ordered the defendant to serve 30 days in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed pending a review on 10/23/15.
-Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling AND/OR Anger Management counseling.
-Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
-Maintain absolute sobriety.
-Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-NO VIOLENT CONTACT with the victim rising to the level of probable cause for arrest.
-Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Court found the Domestic Abuse surcharge is applicable.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
-Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
-Obtain and maintain employment.
-No firearms; weapons.
-Restitution to be set at a hearing.
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Restitution hearing scheduled for July 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for October 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Edwynn Orlando White in court with attorney Elizabeth A Carlson.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case set for sentencing.  Court is in trial and cannot hear the matter.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 18, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Edwynn Orlando White in court with attorney Elizabeth A Carlson.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
AS TO COUNT 2:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered charge dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing.  
.
AS TO COUNT 1: Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.   Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 26, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Edwynn Orlando White in court with attorney Elizabeth A Carlson.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Final Pretrial held.  Case remains set for jury trial on 5/11/15 in Branch 40.  Court reminds defendant the no contact order remains in effect.

Defendant Edwynn Orlando White in court with attorney Elizabeth A Carlson.  Evan K Glaberson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk. 
Pretrial Conference held.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for May 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: Dartanea T. and her children; Santana C. 
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Edwynn Orlando White in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  
Defendant Edwynn Orlando White in custody.  
Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  
Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  
Defendant plead not guilty.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
